title: Defence is forced to blow up an item found by family on the Gold Coast
text:
A family got the shock of their lives after finding a live military device on a beach in Queensland.

The family made the discovery at about 1.30pm on Tuesday and called the police who then called in the army - closing down Fingal Beach on the Gold Coast.

Where the device originated from is not known, however, an army ammunition technician ruled the ordinance was too dangerous to move, according to 9 News.

Experts eventually identified the device as a military marine flare.

The army decided the safest option was to secure the area and conduct a controlled explosion.

Video of the explosion shows the spectacular blast sending a large cloud of sand and smoke into the air - scattering birds and impressing the crowd of onlookers that had gathered on the beach.

'All the debris has been cleared from the beach and it is now a safe area to visit, ' Jackie Lilley from Tweed Byron police said.

'If anybody does find a military device that is clearly marked, please do not touch it and contact the military or the police,' she advised.
